ratings.question_text: Overall, how would you rate the workload of this course in comparison to other Yale courses you have taken:
What is your overall assessment of this course?
What is your overall rating of the primary instructor?
The primary instructor's sensitivity to students and ability to provide students with adequate feedback was:

narratives.question_text: Indicate the total number of hours per week (outside the classroom) you spent on this course:
comments: 5 hours per week
10 hours per week before homework due; 1 hour or less without homeword due
6 hours
10 hours

narratives.question_text: Looking back on this course, what is your overall assessment of the course:  What are its strengths and weaknesses, and in what ways might it be improved?
comments: Strengths: 1. Well Organized lectures 2. Interesting and useful topics 3. Help me to get familiar with R It would be better if more examples are provided in lectures, and if homework solutions are posted online.
Very good course for computational practice and theoritical understanding
Materials cover a board and interesting topics.
It's a very good course and the professor cares about students. We can learn a lot from the problem sets. This course is very useful for future research.
Very nice job, but I hope more examples will be taught
Great course!
Materials covered in this course is very helpful to academic study.
good

narratives.question_text: Please evaluate the instructor of this course. What are the instructor's strengths and weaknesses, and in what ways might his or her teaching be improved?
comments: Instructor: Forrest Crawford  Forrest is very responsible and helpful. I enjoyed his lectures very much. And he's always available to answering questions.
Instructor: Forrest Crawford  very patient and nice; lectures are well-prepared and delievered; homework can also serve the purpose of learning, which is benefitial for students
Instructor: Forrest Crawford  The instructor's lectures are very clear and helpful

Instructor: Forrest Crawford  He is excellent in teaching and knows the materials very well. He is funny in class and describes the concept in a plain way so that everyone can understand it. Lots of people audit this course too and the course material is very useful for future research. He has office hour every week and is very kind and generous to assist students with their research and question. I really learn a lot from him.
Instructor: Forrest Crawford  Very nice person
Instructor: Forrest Crawford  Dr. Crawford's materials are all very useful!
Instructor: Forrest Crawford  The instructor gave very organized lecture and he made complicated method easier to understand.He is really excellent!
Instructor: Forrest Crawford  good

narratives.question_text: How would you summarize this course for a fellow student? Would you recommend it to another student? Why or why not?
comments: I would recommend it to other students. This course is helpful and necessary for students with a quantitative focus.
good course for research preparation; interesting topics along the whole semester should be sufficient using R before taking this course
I highly recommend students from outside biostatistics or medical school take this course because of its usefulness for research in almost every filed, because of the good instructor and TA.
Must have some coding experience
Great course!
Yes, I would recommend it to another student! It is interesting and helpful.
yes
